definition: National Key Disciplines (disciplines recognized as important and supported by PRC central government, including medicine, science, chemistry, engineering, commerce and law)

sentences.english: These traditional disciplines and the use of bamboo weapons remain alive today.

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理学家们对自己的学科都颇为自鸣得意。

sentences.english: But some experts cautioned that the science in the study is still very early.
sentences.chinese: 但有些专家申饬说，研究的学科仍在初期。

sentences.english: Physics are one of my favourite subjects.
sentences.chinese: 物理是我最喜欢的学科之一。

sentences.english: It is intrinsically complex and multi-disciplinary.
sentences.chinese: 它在本质上是复杂和多学科的。

sentences.english: You are exploring the frontiers in science.

sentences.english: The unified construction of the cluster of sub-discipline must have a focus.
sentences.chinese: 这个子学科群的整体构建必有一个重心。

sentences.english: Subject building is the fundamentality of universities and colleges.
sentences.chinese: 学科建设是高等学校的根本。

sentences.english: It takes years to master a new subject.
sentences.chinese: 掌握一门新学科要花多年功夫。

sentences.english: Musical art education should be regarded as one basic discipline during the development of human beings' life.
sentences.chinese: 音乐艺术教育的定位应是人生发展中的基本学科。

sentences.english: An encyclopedia embraces a great number of subjects.
sentences.chinese: 一部百科全书包含许多学科。

sentences.english: History is a very interesting subject.
Cultural Studies provides an indispensable background for the reflection on literary theory as a discipline.
sentences.chinese: 文化研究是文艺学学科反思的重要学术背景。

sentences.english: Library is an important composition part of teaching and scientific research in college and university.
sentences.chinese: 高等学校图书馆是高校教学科研工作的重要组成郑分。
